title: 110_hr6393
content: The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" mandates coverage of counseling for tobacco cessation under the Medicare program. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" requires Medicare to cover counseling for tobacco cessation, including diagnostic, therapy, and counseling services for individuals using tobacco products or undergoing treatment for tobacco use. Services must be provided by a physician or under their supervision. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" mandates Medicare coverage for tobacco cessation counseling services provided by authorized healthcare professionals following clinical guidelines. Payment is provided without a deductible. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" requires Medicare to cover tobacco cessation counseling services without a deductible. Payment for counseling services will be 80 percent of the actual charge or a fee schedule determined by the Secretary. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" mandates Medicare to cover tobacco cessation counseling without a deductible. The amendments will be effective for services provided on or after January 1 of the first calendar year starting at least 6 months after the Act's enactment. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" mandates Medicare to cover tobacco cessation pharmacotherapy under the Medicare program. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" requires Medicare to include tobacco cessation agents as covered drugs, including over-the-counter drugs prescribed by a physician. The "Quit Smoking for Life Act of 2008" mandates Medicare to cover tobacco cessation agents approved by the FDA, including those described in specific sections of the Social Security Act. SEC. 4. Medicaid program to cover counseling and medication for tobacco cessation. Medicaid program coverage for tobacco cessation medications is amended to include FDA-approved agents for promoting tobacco use cessation. The Medicaid program coverage for tobacco cessation medications is expanded to include FDA-approved agents for promoting tobacco use cessation, as well as requiring coverage for tobacco cessation counseling. The Medicaid program expands coverage for tobacco cessation services and medications, treating them as services related to pregnancy for women during pregnancy and the 60-day period after. The effective date for these amendments is January 1 of the first calendar year that begins at least 6 months after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 5. PROMOTING CESSATION OF TOBACCO USE UNDER THE MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH PROGRAM. Quality Maternal and Child Health Services now include counseling and medications for tobacco use cessation, along with antitobacco messages in health promotion counseling. This amendment is effective immediately. The amendment for health services will take effect on the enactment date of the Act.
